greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number such that n-th iterate of Chowla function is 0.
comment: Chowla's function (A048050) = sum of divisors of n except 1 and n.
reference: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..82
M. Lal and A. Forbes, A note on Chowla's function, Math. Comp., 25 (1971), 923-925.
mathematica: chowla[n_] := DivisorSigma[1, n] - 1 - n; chowlaSeq[n_] := Module[{m = n, cnt = 0, seq = {}}, While[m > 0 && ! MemberQ[seq, m], AppendTo[seq, m]; m = chowla[m]; cnt++]; If[m == 0, AppendTo[seq, m]]; seq]; nn = 20; t = Table[0, {nn}]; left = nn; n = 1; While[left > 0, n++; cSeq = chowlaSeq[n]; c = Length[cSeq] - 1; If[cSeq[[-1]] == 0 && c <= nn && t[[c]] == 0, t[[c]] = n; left--]]; t (* _T. D. Noe_, Dec 29 2011 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
